alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 7:10PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Ulster County through 745 PM EDT... At 710 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Phillipsport, or near Ellenville, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingston, New Paltz, Ellenville, Wallkill, Hurley, Modena, High Falls, Kerhonkson, Tillson, Napanoch, Woodland Valley Campground, West Shokan, Olivebridge, Wawarsing, Crawford, Rosendale, Gardiner, Marbletown, Denning and Cherrytown. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central New York.
